title: Hostel Rules Overview
text:
1. Hostel rules are strictly followed as per the guidelines provided through email.
2. Alcohol, smoking, or illegal substances are strictly prohibited.
3. Keep your room and common areas clean. Cleaning the room daily is mandatory.
4. Any violation will result in disciplinary action.
5. Report any maintenance issues through VTOP immediately.
6. Use of electrical appliances like heaters, irons, and cooking devices is prohibited in rooms.

title: Mess Timings and Food Options
text:
1. Mess follows a fixed daily schedule: Breakfast (7:30 AM – 9:00 AM), Lunch (12:30 PM – 2:00 PM), Snacks (5:30 PM – 6:30 PM), Dinner (7:30 PM – 9:00 PM).
2. Vegetarian, non-vegetarian and special menus are available.
3. Monthly mess menu is displayed on hostel notice boards and sent via email.
4. For any food-related issues, contact the mess manager or mess committee.

title: Guest and Visitor Policy
text:
1. Day visitors are not allowed in the hostel premises.
2. Visitors or guests must stay only at the guest house.
3. Overnight stay for visitors is permitted only in designated guest rooms.

title: Laundry Facilities in Hostels
text:
1. Laundry services are available inside hostels with fixed slots.
2. Students can give laundry 4 times a month.
3. Ironing services are available at additional cost.
4. Contact the laundry attendant for issues or special requests.
5. Collect clothes on time to avoid mix-ups.
6. Count your clothes before giving them for laundry.
7. Hostel management is not responsible for lost or damaged clothes.

title: WiFi and Internet Access in Hostels
text:
1. Hostel WiFi is accessible through student login credentials.
2. Internet usage is monitored, and misuse is prohibited.
3. For WiFi complaints, raise a ticket on VTOP under IT Services.
4. For major issues, contact CTS at CB-421.
5. Avoid sharing your login credentials with others.

title: Emergency Contacts and Procedures
text:
1. In emergencies, contact the hostel warden or security immediately.
2. Emergency numbers are displayed on each hostel floor.
3. Follow evacuation procedures during fire drills or emergencies.
4. Report suspicious activities to hostel authorities.
5. Save emergency contacts on your phone for quick access.

title: Room Allotment and Change Policy
text:
1. Room allotment is based on hostel counselling and admission guidelines.
2. Requests for upgradation can be made during recounselling but are subject to availability and valid reasons.
3. Room changes are not guaranteed and may take time.
4. All room changes must be approved by hostel authorities.
5. Students must vacate their current room along with luggage before shifting.
6. Failure to follow procedure may result in penalties.

title: Hostel Fee Structure and Payment Methods
text:
1. Hostel fees must be paid at the beginning of each year as per the fee structure.
2. Payment is accepted only through online banking, UPI, or other online methods.
3. Late payments may incur fines.
4. Keep the hostel allotment letter ready for submission during the allotment process.
5. Save a copy of the allotment letter and payment receipt for future reference.

title: Maintenance and Repair Requests
text:
1. For maintenance issues, raise a complaint in VTOP under Maintenance.
2. Common issues include plumbing, electrical faults, and furniture repairs.
3. Requests are prioritized based on urgency.
4. Regular inspections are conducted to ensure safety.
5. Report damages promptly to avoid complications.

title: Events and Activities in Hostels
text:
1. Regular events and activities are organized by the hostel committee.
2. Students are encouraged to participate in cultural, sports, and recreational activities.
3. Suggestions for new events can be submitted to the committee.
4. Participation helps build a positive hostel environment.

title: Health and Safety Guidelines in Hostels
text:
1. Follow all health and safety guidelines.
2. Maintain personal hygiene and cleanliness.
3. Report health issues to the hostel warden.
4. Follow fire safety protocols and participate in drills.
5. Use electrical appliances safely.
6. Visit the campus health center for medical concerns.

title: Biometric Procedures
text:
1. Biometric is mandatory for hostel residents.
2. Students must check-in and check-out using the biometric system.
3. Failure to use biometrics may result in penalties.
4. Biometric data is used for attendance and security.
5. Ensure biometric data is accurate and updated.

title: Outing and Leave Policies
text:
1. Students must obtain approval from both mentor and warden for leave; outings must be approved by warden.
2. Leave/outing requests must be submitted 48 hours in advance on VTOP.
3. Outings allowed only on Sundays and Mondays; buses arranged from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM.
4. Emergency leave is granted case-by-case.
5. Violating outing rules may result in disciplinary action.

title: Personal Belongings Policy
text:
1. Students are advised not to bring electronic items to the hostel.
2. Unusual items found in hostels will be confiscated and not returned.

title: Night Canteen Timings
text:
1. The night canteen operates from 10:00 PM to 12:00 AM daily.
2. Students must show hostel ID cards to access canteen in other blocks.
3. Students must return to their hostel blocks before 12:00 AM.

title: Hostel Curfew Rules
text:
1. Students are not allowed to leave their hostel block between 9:00 PM and 5:00 AM.
2. Movement outside the block during this time is strictly restricted.
3. Any temporary changes to curfew timings will be officially informed through college email.
4. Exceptions apply only for emergencies or situations approved by the hostel authorities.

title: Food Delivery and Order Pickup Rules
text:
1. Students can collect food delivery orders only until 9:00 PM.
2. On weekdays, delivery personnel are not allowed near hostel blocks; students must collect orders outside the main campus gate.
3. On weekends, delivery personnel are allowed near hostel blocks for order pickup.
4. No delivery pickups are permitted after 9:00 PM.

title: Opposite Gender Entry Rules
text:
1. Students are strictly prohibited from entering hostel blocks of the opposite gender.
2. This restriction applies to all areas including rooms, corridors, and common spaces.
3. Any violation will result in disciplinary action by hostel authorities.

title: Hostel Silence and Noise Control Policy
text:
1. Students must maintain silence inside the hostel blocks at all times.
2. Loud music, shouting, and group noise in corridors or rooms is strictly prohibited.
3. Silence must especially be maintained during night hours to avoid disturbance to other residents.
4. Violation of the noise policy may lead to warnings or disciplinary action.

title: Prohibited Electrical and Cooking Items in Hostels
text:
1. Students are not allowed to use high-power electrical appliances such as iron boxes, hair dryers, immersion rods, or heaters inside hostel rooms.
2. Cooking appliances such as induction stoves, kettles, hot plates, rice cookers, and similar devices are strictly prohibited.
3. Use of any appliance that causes fire risk or overloads electrical circuits is not permitted.
4. Violations will result in immediate confiscation and disciplinary action.

title: Hostel Laundry Usage Rules
text:
1. Students must not submit more than 20 clothes per laundry cycle.
2. Students must count all items before giving the laundry bag and verify the count again while collecting.
3. Immediately report any missing or damaged clothes to the laundry staff or hostel warden.
4. Hostel management is not responsible for unreported discrepancies if not informed on the same day.

title: Daily Room Cleaning and Housekeeping Rules
text:
1. Daily room cleaning is provided for all hostel residents.
2. If cleaning is not done on a particular day, students must immediately report the issue.
3. Complaints can be raised through VTOP, through the cleaning supervisor, or by informing the security officer near the warden’s office.
4. Students must keep their personal belongings arranged to allow cleaners to work efficiently.

title: Hostel Property Damage and Fines
text:
1. In case of damage to hostel property (furniture, fixtures, electrical, doors/windows, etc.) fine will be reflected on VTOP payments, students must immediately contact the hostel warden.
2. The warden will inspect and communicate the applicable fine or action.
3. Charges and the payment method are informed by the warden on a case-by-case basis.

title: Hostel Checkout and Luggage Storage Process
text:
1. Before vacating the hostel, students must hand over their room keys and AC remote (for AC blocks) to the hostel warden or designated staff.
2. No room inspection, clearance form, or NOC is required for checkout.
3. A common cloakroom is available for students to store luggage for up to one month at no additional cost.
4. The cloakroom may become crowded during peak times, and misplaced or mixed-up items have been reported by students.
5. Students are advised not to store valuable or important belongings in the cloakroom and instead keep only non-essential items such as bedding, buckets, or low-value personal items.

title: Hostel Blocks for boys
text:
1.There are 6 hostel blocks for boys
2. The blocks are like MH1,MH2,MH3,MH4,MH5 and MH6.
3. All of the boys hostel blocks are on the right side of CB.

title: Hostel Blocks for girls
text:
1.There are 4 hostel blocks for girls
2. The blocks are like LH1,LH2,LH3 and LH4.
3. All of the girls hostel blocks are on the left side of CB.
